definition: to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.chinese: 法官，5比4，推翻法人獻金限制。

sentences.english: But a higher price wouldn't change the economy of influence.
sentences.chinese: 更高的代價並不會改變政治獻金的魔力。

sentences.english: But the work only assesses external funding.
sentences.chinese: 但是這只是對對外獻金作評價。

sentences.english: How to dispose the anonymous political contributions? 5.
sentences.chinese: 匿名政治獻金應如何處理。

sentences.english: How to punish the people who violate the political contribution management act?
sentences.chinese: 違反政治獻金管理條例應如何處罰。

sentences.english: Mr Edano announced on national television that he would no longer accept corporate contributions.
sentences.chinese: 由人先生在國立電視臺上宣佈他將不再接受企業獻金。

sentences.english: Money should be put in the offertory box.
